name: .RTE File Extension
summary: Learn about .RTE files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: An RTE file is encoded by RTEncoder, a now-discontinued utility for encoding copyrighted content users can securely share. It is saved in the proprietary RTEncoder (RTE) format, which was designed to ensure no user alters, accesses, or distributes the content without authorization. Content creators and distributors were the primary users of RTEncoder, using it to share sensitive files and maintain control over their intellectual property.

content: Russell Cook developed RTEncoder in the early 2000s, and it became popular in the Poser community for securely distributing copyrighted files and modifications. However, alternative methods emerged for securing files, leading the software to decrease in usage among Poser users. Cook no longer develops the software.

instructions: You can open RTE files with RTEncoder and RTEJava. However, both of the programs are discontinued.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
